speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, don't you look nice.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, Frasier wanted me dressed up for this mystery lunch of his.

speaker: Daphne
text: Ha hasn't told you what the occasion is either?

speaker: Martin
text: No, [_sarcastic_] but I'm sure it's something very important. I'm sure he wants to unveil his new antique Elizabethan egg timer.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughs_] Or debut his pre-Columbian spoon rest.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, all.  Well, Dad, I see you're ready to roll.

speaker: Martin
text: Can you at least tell us what kind of restaurant you're taking us to?

speaker: Frasier
text: Patience Dad, Roz will be here in a few minutes and then we'll be off and all will be revealed. [_sits with them_]

speaker: Daphne
text: So, how did it go with the doctor?  Judging by that smile on your face I'm guessing your cholesterol's down.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, after several weeks of watching my diet and taking my medication and race-walking every Tuesday... it hasn't budged. The good news is, though, that I've developed bursitis to take my mind off of it.  The doctor says it's all just a matter of aging.  Well, no reason to let it ruin our festive lunch.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, boy, you don't forget that trip to the doctor, do you? That day he says, "There's nothing I can do for ya, you're just getting old, sport."

speaker: Frasier
text: In my case it was "slugger" but that was the gist.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well, you know what I realize?  When people reach our stage of life...

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please, with all due respect, when it comes to life's journeys, you and I don't share a stage, we're not even in the same theatre.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're taking this all very cheerfully, Dr. Crane. [_doorbell sounds_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_moves to door_] Well, why shouldn't I?  In many ways my life couldn't be better.  I mean, by and large, I'm in good health, there is a promising new relationship on the horizon - the lovely Rachel - [_opens door to Roz_] my career is thriving.

speaker: Roz
text: Did you say thriving or diving?

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Roz
text: Look at these ratings.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, that's nothing to worry about for God's sakes, it's just leveling off.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, that's what tends to happen when you hit bottom.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's no cause for alarm here, Roz.  The important thing is that we go on doing a quality show.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, how about some quality lunch?

speaker: Frasier
text: A splendid idea, Dad.  Off we go, then.  Niles will be joining us there. [_mobile phone rings, he answers_] Hello? Ah, Rachel, yes. [_Roz eavesdrops_] _Momentito._

speaker: Roz
text: So is Donny going to be joining us?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, he's got wedding business this afternoon, he's composing our vows.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, isn't that romantic.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's not exactly Wordsworth strolling through a shady glen. When I left, he was lying on the couch in his underwear with a tin of Vienna sausages and a rhyming dictionary on his chest. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, remember that new promising relationship on the horizon?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: It just got married in Vegas last night.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, great, then you don't have a date for Daphne's wedding?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'll find a date, don't worry, Roz.  Lunch awaits.

speaker: Roz
text: Why don't we go together?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Roz, I assure you my dance card will be punched.

speaker: Roz
text: By who?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know right now, it's just that I will be Crane plus one.

speaker: Roz
text: A-ha, well just in case you don't get a date, what time would you pick me up?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm getting a date.

speaker: Roz
text: Just in case.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm getting a date!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, what time are you picking her up?

speaker: Frasier
text: Three o'clock.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, would you make it three-thirty?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm getting a date! **HE OFTEN FALLS OVER WHILE TYING HIS SHOES**  _Scene Two - Stefano's Italian Restaurant. Frasier, Roz, Daphne and Martin are seated at a table.  There are many caricatures hung on the walls_

speaker: Daphne
text: So, what's the big occasion?

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, wait for it, Daphne, let the moment build.  Besides, Niles hasn't arrived yet.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'd be surprised if he came, he's terrified of this place.

speaker: Frasier
text: Still?  My God, it's been thirty years!

speaker: Roz
text: What happened?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Hester and I brought the boys here when they were kids and Niles was running around, he bumped into the desert trolley and Stefano got hot and yelled at him and Niles got terrified and he, well...

speaker: Frasier
text: He vomited.

speaker: Martin
text: Right.  All over Stefano's shoes.  Then he ran out, hid behind the car and he hasn't been back in here since.

speaker: Roz
text: Poor little weenie.

speaker: Stefano
text: Hey, Dr. Crane, _bon giorno, bon giorno._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good to see you, Stefano, how are you? Allow me to introduce you to Daphne Moon, my father Martin you remember? [_points to Roz_] And this is...

speaker: Stefano
text: Hey, we all know; Roz.  All right, for today we've got some special dishes.  For you, Dr. Crane, porccini fresh from Napa.

speaker: Roz
text: And for me?

speaker: Stefano
text: [_brings over waiter_] Giorgio fresh from Sicily! [_laughs_]

speaker: Roz
text: Can I get him to go?

speaker: Stefano
text: Okay, now, I'm going to be waiting on you myself today, 'kay?  You just give me a minute, I'll come back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, excuse me. [_into phone_] Hello?  Yes, hello, Niles. Oh, really?  Oh, what a shame.

speaker: Martin
text: Told ya.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that's all right, your patient is having a crisis, you'd better address it, before it turns into a crippling, immature, life-long problem! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Daphne
text: You're not really mad at him, are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course I'm mad at him.  I'm certainly going to give him a piece of my mind at dinner tonight.

speaker: Roz
text: Tonight?  Oh, I was hoping you'd come to Alice's birthday party.  My balloon animal guy cancelled and I could really use your help.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Niles made the reservations a month ago, it's at "Quelque Chose!"

speaker: Roz
text: Fine.

speaker: Martin
text: Listen, if Niles isn't coming, maybe you can tell us what the big surprise is?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right, I'll spill.  For over sixty years, Stefano's has immortalized Seattle's famous faces on its walls, as you can see.  With one notable exception.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's me!  Stefano's unveiling  the portrait today.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, how wonderful.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, that's what I'll do for Alice's party.  I'll get a cartoonist to draw the kids.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's an excellent idea, Roz, but let's not forget why we're here, does anybody have a toast?

speaker: Stefano
text: Okay, Dr. Crane.  Here it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: My portrait.

speaker: Stefano
text: No, it's today's specials! [_laughs_] Of course it's your portrait.  Would you like to say a few words, or something...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if you insist.  _Frasier stands and takes out prepared speech cards from his breast pocket._

speaker: Frasier
text: Before we unveil this picture, permit me to paint one of my own.  A picture of a young Frasier Crane, wide eyed, gazing at the walls of Stefano's and wondering, "Who's that?" Well, little did I suspect that one day my picture would be on the wall and perhaps now other children will come in, gaze at it and wonder, "Who's that?"

speaker: Martin
text: I bet that's going to happen a lot!

speaker: Frasier
text: So, thank you, Stefano, for this honor.

speaker: Stefano
text: Thank you, for suggesting it.  And now, I present, _Il Dotor e_, Dr. Frasier Crane! _Stefano pulls back the cloth to reveal a caricature of Frasier. His forehead is exaggerated greatly.  Everyone is laughing except a shocked Frasier.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Daphne, Martin and Frasier are riding up in the elevator._

speaker: Martin
text: Fras, will you let it go, it's a perfectly nice picture.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, so nothing about it jumped out at you as, oh, I don't know, encephalitic!

speaker: Martin
text: So they gave you a big forehead, who cares?  It makes you look smart.

speaker: Frasier
text: It makes me look like I discovered fire! _The elevator stops.  They enter the hallway to meet Niles who is waiting with a box._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I was just leaving you a note apologizing for that flimsy excuse.  I'm sorry, just the thought of going back to that place got my stomach doing flip-flops.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, by the way, Daphne, the doorman gave me this, it's for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_looks at it_] No, it's for Donny.

speaker: Niles
text: No, it's for Mrs. Donny Douglas.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_looks again_] Funny, that's the first time I've seen my name like that.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, get used to it, that's you in a couple of weeks.

speaker: Niles
text: So, how was lunch?  What was the big surprise?

speaker: Martin
text: Don't ask!  The less said, the better.

speaker: Daphne
text: They put his picture on the wall and he thinks his forehead looks a touch too big.

speaker: Frasier
text: A touch?!  I look like a fugitive from Easter Island!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you always think you look bad in pictures.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, it's not some photo I can throw away, this is a picture of me in a famous restaurant.  My God, I dreamed my entire life of being on that wall.

speaker: Niles
text: And now you are.  Are you really so vain that that's not honor enough?

speaker: Frasier
text: Vanity has nothing to do with it!  It's about misrepresentation! And you know, if I were you, I would be careful about bandying about the word vain, Mr. Two-Hundred-And-Fifty-Dollar-Haircut.

speaker: Niles
text: I have problem follicles.

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, it's a caricature, they exaggerate stuff.  Now, if it were me, they would have drawn maybe a big crane, if it were Niles, they'd draw a barber cutting the hair off a giant sucker!

speaker: Daphne
text: I know you're sensitive about your big forehead, but we all have stuff like that.  With me it's my eyes.  I've always fancied sparkling blue ones instead of dull old brown.

speaker: Niles
text: Your eyes?  Your eyes are not dull!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_blushing_] Thank you, Dr. Crane, that's very nice.

speaker: Niles
text: They're warm and... full of life.

speaker: Daphne
text: You have beautiful eyes too. _There is a pause while everyone considers what she has said.  Then Daphne stands up, forcing the thoughts to the back of her mind in mental conflict._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh goodness, I can't be lollygagging around here, I have to... to get Dr. Crane his oatbran.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oatbran?  Now?

speaker: Daphne
text: You'll need it for the morning.  You've got to have something to sop up all that nasty cholesterol gumming up your heart. If not, I'm liable to come home and find you face down on the floor with the dog gnawing off your foot - and I'm not making that up either, that happened.  Cheerio.

speaker: Martin
text: I wished she moved that fast when I'm out of beer! _Niles wonders again what Daphne could have meant... then looks at the box emphasizing "Mrs. Donny Douglas" and puts any thoughts from his mind._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I should be off too.  Are we still on for dinner at "Quelque Chose"?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, of course, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: You might want to call and confirm.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, I'll make a mental note.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, be careful you don't lose it inside that giant puppet head of yours. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  Giant puppet head indeed!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, let it go, Frasier.  What are you going to do?  Go down there and make him change it?  Just accept it for the honor it is, that's all. [_Frasier begins dialing the phone_] You know, I don't get you, a doctor gives you bad news, you take it in stride, but one bad picture...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, thank you, Dad. [_to phone_] Yes, I'm calling about a reservation tonight.  For two, Crane.  Well, what can I say? But I just love your food, Stefano. [_hangs up, off Martin's glance_] I'm in the mood for Italian!  _End of Act One  Act Two  Scene One - Stefano's. Frasier enters and calls to Niles who is stood off stage._

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you come along, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: [_o.s._] I'd really rather not, I'm feeling queasy just standing here.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can't even see the picture from there!  Come on.

speaker: Niles
text: [_enters_] All right, all right, let's just be quick about this.

speaker: Maitre D'
text: Hello, do you have a reservation?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, for Crane.

speaker: Maitre D'
text: One moment.

speaker: Niles
text: You tricked me!

speaker: Frasier
text: We'll just be here long enough for me to talk to Stefano, convince him to change the picture so it doesn't mock me for the rest of my life.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, the man has a violent temper, he's already made me humiliate myself once!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I can't believe you're letting a minor childhood trauma like this plague you.  You know, I have an affinity that this may be the route of your fear of authority figures.  Listen, a nice relaxing dinner here may go a long way towards helping you to resolve this problem.

speaker: Stefano
text: [_shouts over_] _Dotor e, Dotore_, how nice to see you again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Stefano, good to see you.

speaker: Stefano
text: And who's this gentleman?  Looks familiar to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, this is my brother, Niles.

speaker: Stefano
text: Oh, of course, you have the family forehead.  Er, come on.

speaker: Stefano
text: [_shouting_] Hey, Antonio, slow down! [_he babbles some Italian and forces Antonio back into the kitchen_] What's-a matter with you? [_to Frasier_] Come on, sit down, we've got a nice table for you.

speaker: Stefano
text: Right under your picture.  Okay, tonight - no menus, I'm going to take care of everything - except the bill, of course. [_laughs and exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there it is, "Frasier Cranium"!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it does have a certain under-nuanced, over-contoured, Macy's parade kind of quality.  But you cannot ask him to change it, the man will explode.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not if I do it with the utmost tact.

speaker: Stefano
text: Okay, here we are; antipasto.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, that's wonderful Stefano.  You know, you certainly do have a way of making people feel comfortable.  You know, I suspect that it would actually physically pain you to think that someone wasn't totally pleased.

speaker: Stefano
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Niles shakes his head_] Well, actually, there is a tiny tiny problem.  Really it's about my picture, you see.  There is a small faction that thinks the forehead is too large.

speaker: Stefano
text: [_points to Niles_] What, this one?

speaker: Niles
text: No, I love it... [_holds back sick_]

speaker: Frasier
text: As do I.  It's just that, well, I feel I may be more recognizable if the forehead were a tad smaller.

speaker: Stefano
text: So, you don't like it?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not that.

speaker: Stefano
text: It's not good enough for you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it is.

speaker: Stefano
text: Do you want me to have it changed?

speaker: Frasier
text: Could you? _FADE TO:  Scene Two - Stefano's. Frasier and Niles have eaten their way through many dishes._

speaker: Niles
text: How long is this going to take?

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Niles, I was fortunate enough that the artist is actually here tonight.  I'm certainly not going to rush him.  Now, you know, you better finish your lasagna, you don't want to offend Stefano.

speaker: Niles
text: Offend him?  So far tonight I have had the Prosciutto Di Palma, the Pasta Genovese and the Venetian Sea Bass.  One more bite will conclude our little tour of Italy with my impression of Pompeii!

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, hey, look who it is. [_laughs_] They'll let anyone in this joint!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Kenny.

speaker: Kenny
text: So, what are you celebrating?  Not your ratings, huh!  I'm kidding, you've gotta kid!  If you don't laugh, you cry, right?  So, did I hear a rumor that you're going up on the wall of fame?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, as a matter of fact they're putting the finishing touches on the picture right now.

speaker: Kenny
text: Isn't that something? [_to Niles_] Hey, hey, hey, you better save some room.  Stefano goes crazy if you pass on his dessert.  My mother found out that the hard way on her eightieth birthday.  He went off on her.  He called her a "scungo bungo" or something, the kids had it memorized for a while.  Enjoy.

speaker: Stefano
text: Okay, Dr. Crane.  Hot off the easle, is this one more to your liking?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my.

speaker: Stefano
text: Is it better?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's like looking in a mirror.  _Frasier holds the portrait up to Niles. The picture makes Frasier look more macho, with more defined features and more muscles_

speaker: Stefano
text: You know, this is the first time that anybody has ever asked for a change! [_puts it on the wall_] Oh, beautiful, you make me so happy!  I'll go and see how the steaks are coming.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I hate to burst your bubble, but that picture looks absolutely nothing like you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, well, I was wondering when Mr. Envy would pull up a chair. [_Kenny passes_] Oh, Kenny.  Kenny, if I may, can I direct your attention to this caricature?

speaker: Kenny
text: Wow, look at that, I am impressed.

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought you might be.

speaker: Kenny
text: James Garner eats here!

speaker: Frasier
text: James Garner?!

speaker: Kenny
text: Well, I guess I can go and sit down now, my father-in-law just picked up the check.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't believe this!  I've waited my entire life to have my picture on this wall.  Now that it is, it's unrecognizable. Well, not for long.

speaker: Niles
text: No, Frasier, you are not going to ask him to change it again...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: If this means so much to you, my girlfriend's a plastic surgeon, she can have you looking like this picture in six procedures or less!

speaker: Stefano
text: [_with more food_] All right, here we are boys, here we are. Monjo Pere!

speaker: Stefano
text: You know, there's something that's been bugging me all night. Hey, shove over, will you? [_they do, to Niles_] I know you from some place and I can't figure out where, this is driving me potso!  So, we're gonna figure this out together, okay?  You and me.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, while the two of you are strolling down memory lane, I have a quick errand I have to run, I tell you what, save some dessert for me!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier...  _However, Frasier runs out the front door.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Roz's Apartment. The apartment is bustling with kids and parents, there are balloons and banners all celebrating Alice's birthday.  Frasier enters and sees Roz with Alice._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, I knew you'd show up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well...

speaker: Roz
text: You knew how much it would mean to me and Alice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh gosh, am I that transparent?

speaker: Roz
text: Come on in, everyone, this is Frasier. [_they all wave_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, hi.

speaker: Roz
text: Can I get you something?  Jello, Lunchables, a Pokemon punch?

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you have any coffee made?

speaker: Roz
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's perfect. [_off her look_] Well, while you're making coffee it'll give me some quality time with Alice. [_takes her_] _Frasier walks to the cartoonist and pushes in to the queue.  The girl in the queue is angry._

speaker: Girl
text: Hey, no cuts.

speaker: Frasier
text: I need a picture right away.

speaker: Girl
text: I'll tell.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know who this is?  This is the birthday girl.  If she wants a picture right away, she's going to get a picture right away, now why don't you just run along?  _She does eventually.  Meanwhile, Frasier takes the caricature of the cartoonist and takes the girl in the seat away._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, I think you're finished, there you are.

speaker: Girl
text: But I don't have any eyes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, neither did Little Orphan Annie, and she's got her own Broadway show, now go on, shoo! [_sits_] Okay, fine, I'm looking for something manly, go easy on the forehead, leave the kid out.  _The cartoonist starts drawing as Alice looks into the crowd.  FADE TO:_  **FACE ON/OFF/ON...**  _Scene Four - Stefano's. Niles is sat finishing his desert as Frasier enters_

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Where the hell have you been?  Stefano's been trying to place me for the last forty minutes.  Was I ever in Panama?  Did I sell him his first Lincoln?  Do I have a box at the dog track?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Why didn't you just say yes and let that be the end of it?

speaker: Niles
text: That's a good idea. [_notices pictures in Frasier's hands_] What's that?

speaker: Frasier
text: I went by Alice's birthday party, I had the artist there draw me some new sketches.  There, what do you think?

speaker: Niles
text: I think you're insane!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, it's not so crazy, just imagine.  Suppose that picture there should accidentally drop to the floor and tear.  You see, I can come back here tomorrow, tell Stefano that I didn't want to put his artist to any more trouble and I had a new caricature done myself.  You see, I'm actually quite partial to this one here, but there is one in here of me playing soccer which is very good...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, we'll put these away, we'll pay the bill and we'll find a bed to strap you into.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, it can work, it really can, it'll work...

speaker: Mama
text: What is this?  The pictures?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's nothing, it's no business of yours, off you go.

speaker: Mama
text: Stefano!  Stefano!

speaker: Stefano
text: [_enters_] Mama, what is it?  _Cara Mia,_ what?

speaker: Mama
text: [_points to pictures_] _Guada, guada!_

speaker: Stefano
text: Dr. Crane, what is this?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right, I may as well just tell you the truth.  The fact is, I don't really care for this picture either.  It's just that I'm afraid your artist has lost his touch.  To be honest I think he's robbing you blind.  I mean, my God, how much is this hack charging you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Mama's the hack, isn't she? _Stefano goes ballistic and throws Frasier out of the restaurant. Niles, shaking uncontrollably, tries to exit but Stefano has a word with him._

speaker: Stefano
text: Hold on one second!  Now I remember you!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh...

speaker: Stefano
text: Bridgeport, Connecticut.

speaker: Niles
text: [_thinks and then acts_] Yes, yes.

speaker: Stefano
text: My car got stuck in the rain and you saved my ass.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well it was nothing.  I'm glad you remember.

speaker: Stefano
text: Let me show you how we thank you where I come from.  _Stefano kisses him on both cheeks and then takes him in a big hug, we can see the vomit welling up inside him.  FADE TO:  Scene Five - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is sat talking to Martin._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, suffice it to say, the entire Crane family is now banned from Stefano's.

speaker: Martin
text: Just because of that dumb picture?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, actually, there was a little incident involving Niles, too.  He was doing just fine until Stefano took him in some sort of a bear hug and shook him a little too vigorously.

speaker: Martin
text: On the shoes again?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, this time there was a conveniently-placed lobster tank.

speaker: Martin
text: Poor Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, it wasn't any picnic for the lobsters either.

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell is wrong with me, Dad?  You know, I got so obsessed with that damn picture I completely lost my head!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I think I know what's really going on here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, enlighten us.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I think there's some stuff in your life that you can't control: the doctor tells you you're getting old, your ratings are low, you're not happy with your love life.  And so I think you obsessed about this picture because you figured it was something in your life that you could control.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Dad, you do raise a point.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what the hell, you're dead on.  Where did you learn so much about psychology?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I listen to radio.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, it's so obvious, isn't it?  You know, when a person is confronted with some deeply troubling issue that they're not ready to face yet, they usually avoid the problem by obsessing about something else, something completely trivial.

speaker: Daphne
text: Got it!

speaker: Martin
text: Got what?

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane's oat bran!

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, you left for that eight hours ago.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, it wasn't easy.  They were out of it at the regular market, so I went to another one but then they were out of it. So, I looked into it and it turns out they don't sell it in Washington anymore.  Well, for some reason I just couldn't let it go, so I went for a little drive. [_to Martin_] You know, it wouldn't kill you to do something like that once in a while, get off that big round duff of yours. [_then_] Anyway, a hop, skip and a jump later, here it is, fresh from Portland. Good night.

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell was that?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know, what did she mean about that big round duff comment?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, the sands of time don't exactly flow up the hourglass!  It's not easy for a guy our age.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, for the last time, we are not the same age.

speaker: Martin
text: I've seen your hips start to spread a little bit...  _Martin and Frasier carry on arguing.  End of Act Two_
